intro: Camphora griffithii, commonly known as the Indian camphor tree, is a deciduous tree native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the樟科 (Lauraceae) family and is characterized by its aromatic bark and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers followed by dark blue berries. Its wood is valued for its camphor content, which has medicinal and industrial uses. The tree is also noted for its ability to thrive in high-altitude regions with cool climates.
